Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014003751.CaseDesc: Lucien Sale was last seen driving his truck in Chisholm, Alberta on September 21, 1991. On September 26, 1991, his truck was located abandoned on a logging road off into the bush.

Case reference: 2015036270.CaseDesc: Brian Franko was last seen on July 10, 2015, walking away from the Saskatchewan Hospital.  He did not appear to be in a good frame of mind.  Brian was walking toward the South Saskatchewan River when he was last seen.  Extensive searches were conducted, with no success.

Case reference: 2006019499.CaseDesc: David Block was reported missing from Swastika, Ontario. He had been seen in Newfoundland in 1994.  Mr. Block suffered from mental health issues that could bring him to the attention of authorities. He was last seen in Washington D.C., U.S.A, on May 1, 1995.

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Star on thumb and index finger
Left Shoulder, Dagger and inverted snake head and a name (unknown)

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014003765.CaseDesc: On the morning of August 11, 1994, Neil Hicks was seen for the last time leaving his temporary residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Neil suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991 from Saint John, New Brunswick. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left his place of work at 3pm the day he went missing. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2021057680.CaseDesc:
Frances Gazeley was last seen on the evening of December 7, 2021. She was last
seen in the Weyburn, Saskatchewan area but could also be in the Ceylon, Minton,
Bengough, and Colgate areas. Multiple searches have been completed since Frances was reported missing but she has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004125.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1979, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP Detachment received a report that David Voisey had gone through the ice while riding as a passenger on a snowmobile near Epinette Point, North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. Mr. Voisey  has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005423.CaseDesc: On January 22, 1971, Maryse Chalette was seen for the last time when she went out for a walk at approximately 12:30 p.m., in the Joliette area in Quebec. Maryse was placed in foster care by the CHRDL Hospital.

Case reference: 2014005207.CaseDesc: On June 01, 2008, Bartholomew MacIsaac was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005960.CaseDesc: On December 26th, 2012 at approximately 11:45 am Raymond Nothdurft was last observed near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Raymond was despondent.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Wears a moustache
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Left Ring Finger, Three to four small diamonds in a diagonal
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Ring, Right Little Finger, No lettering or logo
Scar: Right Knee, Small laparoscopic surgical scar on knee cap
Left Knee, Small laparoscopic surgical scar on knee cap
Tattoo: Right Ankle, Soccer ball with red maple leaf on outside

Case reference: 2018062802.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2000, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Yao Lin was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020008550.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1984, Anita Tamboom was seen for the last time by her neighbour in Toronto, Ontario. Anita was known to frequently leave her home for extended periods, but she would always return. During the time of her disappearance, Anita was suffering from some mental health issues, and her purse was located on the shores of Lake Ontario.

Case reference: 2023039179.CaseDesc: Denis Taylor was last seen on July 22, 2023 at the Bulpit Lake Family Camp, located on Stringer Road in Carlow Mayo Township, East of Bancroft, Ontario. Denis planned to meet everyone in the common beach area after a brief nap in his cabin, which was located a distance away, but he never arrived. Denis may have woke up disoriented in the new cabin and taken the wrong path to the communal area.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeve checkered shirt

Case reference: 2014001898.CaseDesc: According to her husband, Isabell Brooks left her home near Highway 7 and Tenth Concession (now Reesor Road) in Markham, Ontario on foot on March 4, 1972. Isabell said she'd return in a week, but she was never seen again.

Mark: Head, Mole on top of head

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2014001445.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1992, Howard Scott was last seen in Calgary, Alberta. Howard was travelling in his red 1985 Ford LTD Station Wagon from Calgary and was destined to return to Richmond, British Columbia. On August 15, 1992, Howard’s abandoned vehicle was located in a heavily wooded logging road near Moyie, British Columbia.  Howard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2014002590.CaseDesc: On April 15, 2000, Merlin Labrie was seen for the last time as he left a gathering with friends in Levis, Quebec. Merlin was supposed to meet up with a friend, but he never did and has not been seen since.

Mark: Head, Multiple beauty marks on the face

Case reference: 2012020141.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1999, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Julie Surprenant was seen for the last time as she got off of a bus in the neighbourhood of L’Île St-Jean, in Montreal, Quebec. None of the clothing that she had worn that day were found at her residence; which suggests that Julie did not go home after getting off of the bus.

Coat: Leather, Brown, With the top plaid
Tattoo: Buttocks, dragon, size of a quarter

Case reference: 2006020099.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1974, Louis Wesley was last seen in Chamberlain Narrows, Lac Seul. He was involved in a boating accident and is presumed to have drowned in the lake, 48 km north of Hudson. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2014001632.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Dorion was last seen by a friend at a local fishing camp on September 21, 1999. Ms. Dorion arrived at the fishing camp on the 17th of September with her friends and stayed there approximately 4 days. She was never seen again. Two separate ground searches were carried out. Several steep embankments as well as the area surrounding the camp were searched with negative results. Ms. Dorion's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020089.CaseDesc: Michel Guy Favreau lived alone in Nipawin, Saskatchewan at the time of his disappearance. Michel suffered from depression and he was last heard from and seen between September 22nd and September 25th, 2011. On October 4th, 2011 his vehicle, a 1998 green Chrysler Intrepid, was located abandoned at Carroll's Cove camp ground near Nipawin. Several searches were conducted in hopes of locating him were unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred

Case reference: 2014006037.CaseDesc: On March 21, 2013, Bruno Pouliot went to a medical appointment. Later that evening, Bruno was last seen in a pharmacy located in Saint-Pierre-de-l’île-d’Orléans, Québec. Bruno lived in the Donnacona area and was known to go snowshoeing on the frozen St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2020011793.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1985, Ruth Koenig was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ruth had taken some time off from working following the death of her husband on October 18, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014003823.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1996, Patricia Ferguson was seen for the last time in the Pointe-aux-Trembles district of Montreal, Quebec. That night, Patricia had slept at a friend's place but had left the apartment, without her young daughter. She left a note saying she was going out for breakfast, and then meeting her sister. Patricia has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist

Case reference: 2023011363.CaseDesc: Isabella (Rui) Dan was last seen around 8 p.m. on March 3, 2023. According to a witness, it is alleged she asked for a ride to an intersection thought to be in the Town of Markham, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2023004799.CaseDesc: Sheena Beaver was last seen in Calgary, Alberta in December 2022. At the time of her disappearance, Sheena was despondent.

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2022041482.CaseDesc: Henry McAdam, originally from the Big River First Nation in Saskatchewan, was last seen on July 14,2022 in the area of Prince Albert. He was reported missing by a family member on July 24, 2022. Henry adopted a transient and high-risk lifestyle and he is known for using housing resources for the homeless. There is no indication of foul play at this time.

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014005038.CaseDesc: On February 15,2005, Barry Sloper was last observed in the area of the Table Rock Complex in Niagara Falls, Ontario.  At the time of his disappearance, he was despondant.

Teeth: Other, Broken, missing upper teeth, partial upper dentures

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2014002734.CaseDesc: Martin Munawych was last seen leaving a relative's home near Lac La Biche, Alberta on June 1, 1975, appearing to be well at the time. It is thought that Martin may have travelled to Edmonton or Calgary. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020040144.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1950, Mabel Crumback was seen for the last time at approximately 12:30 am at her home located in Toronto, Ontario. Mabel had been babysitting her younger brother while her family was out of town. The following morning, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2014004947.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2007, Ralph Hopper was seen for the last time as he was leaving the l'Aboiteau residence, a special care home where he lived in Dieppe, New Brunswick. Ralph is mentally challenged, diabetic and requires prescription medication.

Case reference: 2014000020.CaseDesc: Lorraine Roach was last seen at home at approximately 1:30 a.m. on May 11, 2013, by her husband. He indicated that she was upset over a family matter and was heading to the local casino. She left driving her vehicle, which was later found parked on the side of the road near a walking trail about 7 kilometers from her home. She never went to the casino that evening.

Pierce: Ears, both ears have 3 piercings with diamond studs

Case reference: 2018054233.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2018, Xinye Wang was last seen in China. Xinye was scheduled to return to Canada but has not been heard from or seen since.

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2020041548.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2020, Horacio Calderon Alvidrez was last seen moving out from his residence in New Westminster, British Columbia. Horacio has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2014004557.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1992, at approximately 8:30am, Oscar Casaseca was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. Oscar’s wife had seen him before she returned to work, and when she returned home he was gone.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014004240.CaseDesc: Sheilagh Coleman was reported missing on August 22, 2000 by her mother. Her mother last saw her on August 1, 2000 when she visited her in Gibsons, B.C. The last reliable sighting of Sheilagh was believed to be August 21, 2000 by a neighbour. They saw her leaving the residence of her boyfriend on her bicycle. Numerous people were interviewed that were associated to her and was much contradiction regarding the dates and events in order of which Sheilagh was last seen.

Case reference: 2014005631.CaseDesc: Daniel Schultz was last seen by family on May 10, 1996 at a wedding in Chemainus, British Columbia.  Daniel was a dual citizen and lived in Seattle, Washington.  Seattle Police Department had contact with him after the wedding.  Daniel has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008004699.CaseDesc: Adave Francis was last seen October 12, 1999, at 6:00 p.m. riding his bicycle on the farm property located at Poplar side road in the Collingwood area. Mr. Francis was a seasonal worker from Jamaica.

Case reference: 2014002473.CaseDesc: On July 4, 1991, Gabriel Bukredji was seen for the last time in the Saint-Leonard district of Montreal, Quebec. Gabriel was despondent and had also mentioned he was interested in purchasing property in another country.

Sweater: Pink, Blue circle on the back.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2014005209.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1990, at approximately 10:15am, Cindy Clair was seen for the last time near 25 Martha Eaton Way in Toronto, Ontario. Ms. Clair told her roommate she was going for a walk and never returned.

Case reference: 2013000027.CaseDesc: Nancy Joanne Forbes has not been seen or heard from since November 7, 2006. She was last seen at a bus stop on her way to a job interview in the Burnside Industrial Park in Dartmouth NS.

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Luggage: Blue, Metal box and a tent

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005279.CaseDesc: Brian Guberman was reported missing in July 1974. Brian owned a black and yellow 1964 Volkswagon van that has never been located.

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2014003189.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1986, Michel Guertin was seen for the last time in Sorel-Tracy, Quebec. Michel has not been seen or not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered
